block.p: Julia Anne Elliott Clarkson, the daughter of Eleanor M. Clarkson of Wellesley, Mass., and Dr. Geoffrey P. E. Clarkson of Las Vegas, was married last evening to Steven Jonathan Sherman Glick, the son of Dr. Georgia S. Glick and Dr. Thomas H. Glick of Lexington, Mass. The Rev. Dr. Helen Lutton Cohen, a Unitarian Universalist minister, performed the ceremony at King's Chapel in Boston.

Ms. Clarkson, 30, is keeping her name. She is the director of revenue for HiCitizen.com, a government information Web site based in Newton, Mass. She graduated from Dartmouth College and received an M.B.A. degree from Harvard University. Her father is a business consultant to troubled companies and is also a writer. Her mother is a telephone counselor at the American Cancer Society in Boston.

Julia Anne Elliott Clarkson, the daughter of Eleanor M. Clarkson of Wellesley, Mass., and Dr. Geoffrey P. E. Clarkson of Las Vegas, was married last evening to Steven Jonathan Sherman Glick, the son of Dr. Georgia S. Glick and Dr. Thomas H. Glick of Lexington, Mass. The Rev. Dr. Helen Lutton Cohen, a Unitarian Universalist minister, performed the ceremony at King's Chapel in Boston.

Ms. Clarkson, 30, is keeping her name. She is the director of revenue for HiCitizen.com, a government information Web site based in Newton, Mass. She graduated from Dartmouth College and received an M.B.A. degree from Harvard University. Her father is a business consultant to troubled companies and is also a writer. Her mother is a telephone counselor at the American Cancer Society in Boston.

Mr. Glick, 31, is a management consultant at the Boston Consulting Group. He graduated from Harvard and received a master's degree in political science from the College of Europe in Bruges, Belgium, and an M.B.A. from the University of Pennsylvania. His mother is a fund-raising consultant to universities and nonprofit organizations. His father is the chief of neurology at the Cambridge (Mass.) Hospital and is an associate professor of neurology at Harvard Medical School.
